definition: to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: His firm was named in homage to the Beatles' record label, Apple.
sentences.chinese: 他的公司命名蘋果以向披頭士樂隊的唱片致敬。

sentences.english: Decca Recording Co. , rejecting the Beatles, 1962
sentences.chinese: 德克唱片公司，拒絕披頭士的評語，1962。

sentences.english: The beatles cut their first disc in 1962 .
sentences.chinese: 披頭士樂隊於1962灌製了他們的第一張唱片。

sentences.english: We also did some Beatles covers and got to be kind of psychedelic.
sentences.chinese: 我們也做披頭士的翻唱而那有點迷幻。

sentences.english: People like music here, which I also enjoy and I like the Beatles.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的人愛音樂，我也很喜歡，特別是披頭士。

sentences.english: The Beatles don't exist anymore but their music will live in everyone forever.
sentences.chinese: 披頭士樂隊已經不在，可是他們的音樂將流傳下去。

sentences.english: This sub-graph represents, of course, the Beatles and people who have been strongly associated with them.
sentences.chinese: 這個子圖指出了披頭士樂隊和與他們高度相關的人。

sentences.english: The Beatles grew up in the poor, industrial city of Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 披頭士們出身在貧窮的工業城市利物浦。

sentences.english: "Until the Beatles exposed the origins, the white kids didn't know anything about the music, " says Veteran Blues Shouter Waters, 52.
sentences.chinese: 在披頭士原創之前，白人對音樂簡直是一無所知。

sentences.english: And then of course the musicians learnt to control their creations, the Beatles in the van.
sentences.chinese: 之後，音樂家們當然學會了留一手，比如披頭士樂隊。

sentences.english: Blowing Away Cobwebs. Even the Beatles' nonmusical utterances tend to take on the tone and weight of social prophecy.
sentences.chinese: 披頭士的非音樂觀點甚至有了社會預言的能力。

sentences.english: And there is still the hardy minority that insists on viewing the Beatles as the great put-on of the century.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些少數強硬派認定披頭士是本世紀最大的騙子。

sentences.english: The Beatles cut their first disc in 1962.
sentences.chinese: 披頭士樂隊於1962年灌了第一張唱片。

sentences.english: It's the first re-release of the Beatles catalog since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 這是自1987年以來首次重新發布披頭士專輯。

sentences.english: Beatles and Rihanna fans led the middle of the lowest.
sentences.chinese: “披頭士”以及蕾哈娜粉絲的開放水平居於中下等。

sentences.english: I was like the Jewish Beatle.

definition: genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
from the inside to the outside/through and through/thoroughly
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
Yokosuka (port and navy base in the Tokyo bay)
